A River Runs Through It is based on the true story of two fly fishing brothers, Norman and Paul, (Brad Pitt and Craig Sheffer) whose Reverend father (Harris Yulin) tries to teach them the importance of faith and religion. Christian Bale plays the role of the narrator Norman and the film follows him between his return to the town of his birth and his job as a professor.
A brilliant film and a love story as well.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was originally a novel of French humorist Georges Wolinski. Since I'm not familiar with his work, I have no other reference to compare it to. What we have is a successful film that has achieved cult status and has been written about. But what does it deal
